intro: Dodecatheon amethystinum f. margaritaceum, commonly known as the pearl larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the genus Dodecatheon, which is part of the family Primulaceae, known for its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant features delicate, nodding flowers that are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive white or pale pink throat. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
